summary:
11. Urges parties to support the development of national institutions and local civil society networks to provide assistance to women and girls affected by conflict.

12. Calls on Member States to comply with their obligations to end impunity and prosecute those responsible for serious international crimes.

13. Recalls the right to reparations for victims of international law violations.

14. Urges women's full and meaningful participation in efforts to combat the illicit transfer and misuse of small arms and light weapons.

15. Reiterates its intention to convene a High-level Review in 2015 to assess progress on implementing resolution 1325 (2000) and encourages Member States to review and accelerate progress.

16. Invites the Secretary-General to commission a global study on the implementation of resolution 1325 (2000) and submit a report to the Security Council in 2015.

17. Expresses its intention to focus on the women, peace, and security mandate during a periodic field visit.

18. Requests the Secretary-General to submit annual reports on the implementation of resolution 1325 (2000).

19. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
